relation: One of the best months to visit Delhi and the temperature is very cold and allows great opportunities for sightseeing. Mornings are very foggy and visibility can be very low. Extra care required if travelling with kids and old people.

An ideal month for taking up holiday packages as the climate becomes quite comfortable for all tourists activities. Light woolens will be required in the evenings. Lot of blue skies and enough sunshine makes it a good time for outdoor activities during the day.

Temperature starts to rise and the city is welcomes the spring season. The cool breeze takes over the cold waves, giving a new life to nature. One of the best and also the last high tourist season for travelling to Delhi. The temperatures are starting to rise but still in the comfortably hot range.

Summer season starts from this month and the temperatures can reach a level that is too high for most people's liking. The sky is mostly blue and plenty of sunshine keeps the days warmer. Evenings can get a bit cooler but it might be the best month for travel. Excursions tot he nearby hill station can be enjoyed.

Blue skies, plenty of sunshine and hot winds rule this month and the temperature can go way beyond the comfortable zone. Sunstroke is a common occurrence and this might not be the best time for travelling to Delhi.

The sun continue to scorch and keeps the weather hot. Monsoon is expected to hot the region somewhere in the middle of the month. Intermittent rainfall reduces the temperature a but, but the humidity makes it difficult for travelling.

The monsoon has truly arrived and regular rainfall continues to soak the city. It might rain for longer duration and helps in cooling the soaring heat. However, humidity along with heat makes it a bit uncomfortable for travel.

The wettest month of the year. Rainfall occurs for long duration and is an inconvenience rather than a major annoyance. There may be several days without rain, but cloud will dominate the sky, making the temperatures bearable.

One of the best months for travelling as the monsoon settles down to a less annoying level. It might rain but the downpour will be short. Temperatures start to get comfortable with cooling breezes in the evenings. Weather is quite favorable for sightseeing. Delhi serves an ideal base for many destinations so if you donât want to limit your holiday within Delhi, then several weekend packages from Delhi are also available.

Delhi is a significant part of North India tourism and weather during October is most beautiful with clear skies and good amount of sunshine. Monsoon has completely gone away and nature has blossomed to its fullest. Temperatures start to decrease from the end of this month and are comfortable with a cooling breeze. Ideal month for sightseeing and other tourist activities.

A high season for Delhi tourism. Days are pleasant but nights are cool and can get chilly. The sky will be a mixture of cloud and blue with beautiful sun shines. The temperature is within the comfortable range and is ideal for indulging in outdoor activities. Winter starts from the end of this month.

December is one of the best months to travel. The end of the month especially during the Christmas week, it get spine chilling cold and care should be taken if kids or old people are accompanying. Sun shines through making the days less cold.

textAfterTable: View all photos Best Season: Feb - Apr, Aug - Nov Summer 25 to 47Â°C, Winter 1 to 25Â°C Best Season / Best time to visit Delhi Delhi presents a high variation between the summers and winters climates. Best season to visit Delhi is from August to March. Winters (December to February) are very chill, with temperature dropping down to 1°C. January is foggy with heavy fogs disrupting traffics. This period is ideal for tourism in Delhi. Summers (March to June) are scorching with temperature rises to 47°C. Typically tourists avoid visting Delhi during the hot months of April to June. Monsoons (July to September) are accompanied with heavy flooding rains intermittently. The gardens in Delhi are getting enlivened up during the monsoons. July to September is good for city trips and short sightseeing trips. Keep a watch on road blocks due to rains. October to December is ideal for all kinds of sightseeing activities in and around Delhi.
